response.raw_message_text:
{
  "risk_factors": [
    ["Age", "high", "At 18, the subject is at an age generally associated with higher recidivism rates, as younger individuals tend to have higher risk profiles."],
    ["Gender", "medium", "Being male is associated with a higher tendency toward re-arrest, though it is only one of many factors."],
    ["Prior Arrest History", "medium", "A single arrest, even without conviction, indicates some exposure to the criminal justice system, which may elevate risk."],
    ["Race/Ethnicity", "low", "Hispanic ethnicity in itself is not considered a strong predictor of recidivism risk."],
    ["Education", "low", "Having a high school diploma suggests a level of educational attainment that can be protective against recidivism."],
    ["Employment History", "low", "Holding two jobs in a year shows some degree of stability and engagement that may lower recidivism risk."],
    ["Substance Use", "low", "The absence of drug use in the past four years is a protective factor."],
    ["Mental Health", "low", "Not feeling depressed recently suggests that severe mental health issues are not currently influencing risk."],
    ["Family Background", "low", "Growing up in a stable environment with both biological parents in an urban household is a mitigating factor."],
    ["Religious Beliefs", "low", "Attributing events to divine will may contribute positively to rehabilitation and personal accountability."]
  ],
  "prediction": "YES",
  "confidence": 70
}

risk_factors: At 18, the subject is at an age generally associated with higher recidivism rates, as younger individuals tend to have higher risk profiles.
Being male is associated with a higher tendency toward re-arrest, though it is only one of many factors.
A single arrest, even without conviction, indicates some exposure to the criminal justice system, which may elevate risk.
Hispanic ethnicity in itself is not considered a strong predictor of recidivism risk.
Having a high school diploma suggests a level of educational attainment that can be protective against recidivism.
Holding two jobs in a year shows some degree of stability and engagement that may lower recidivism risk.
The absence of drug use in the past four years is a protective factor.
Not feeling depressed recently suggests that severe mental health issues are not currently influencing risk.
Growing up in a stable environment with both biological parents in an urban household is a mitigating factor.
Attributing events to divine will may contribute positively to rehabilitation and personal accountability.

prompt.system:
You are a highly experienced criminal justice risk assessment expert
employing advanced statistical and judicial knowledge.
prompt.user:
You are a criminal risk assessment expert. Step back, take a deep breath and carefully think step by step to assign a relative weight [low, medium, high] to each risk factor before using them to collectively predict 3-year rearrest recidivism:
The person is an 18-year-old male who identifies himself as Hispanic. He has been arrested 1 time but has not been convicted. He is 5 feet 9 inches and weighs 147 lbs. He has never been married and is currently living alone. He has a high school diploma and is not enrolled in college. He has held 2 jobs during the year. He has not used any drugs in the past four years and has not felt depressed over the past month. At a young age, he lived with both of his biological parents in a household of size 6, in an urban area. He considers that God has something to do with what happens to him personally.

After your analysis, you must respond ONLY with a JSON object in exactly this format, with no additional text:

{
  "risk_factors": [
    ("factor1", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ("factor2", "low"|"medium"|"high", "textual reasoning"),
    ...
  ],
  "prediction": "YES" or "NO",
  "confidence": number between 0 and 100
}
